Do you want to delete this picture?
Adding a photo will make the note much more useful.
"What is the name of this road?"
"as written on the street sign, abbreviations are expanded:"

"Sometimes the street sign is only at one end of the street. Also, note that there may not be extra street signs for side streets that belong to a bigger street. Usually, any street with houses has a name."
"If the name can be spelled without an abbreviation, then it should be expanded. Many common abbreviations are expanded automatically while you type, but probably not all."
"In other words, is it open any time, every day?"
"Can you contribute anything to this note?"
"Can’t scan here. Try to zoom in further or tilt the map less."
"Stop the current search and scan here instead?"
"Location is off. Open Settings to turn it on now?"
"Your location is needed to scan for quests in your vicinity."
"You need to authorize with your OSM user account to publish your answers. Authorize now?"
"This version of StreetComplete is too old. Please update!"
"To scan for quests around you automatically, turn on location"
"It is something like a driveway or parking aisle"
"It is an agricultural or forest road"
None of the above, it simply has no name
"Be concise, ideally use the wording from the sign, e.g. “by appointment”. The absence of a sign does not necessarily mean that there are no regular opening hours."
"How many levels does this building have?"
"How many levels does this building part have?"
"What basic shape does this building’s roof have?"

"

Ah, someone who cares about privacy, nice! I think I have only good news for you:

Direct Contributions

First off, understand that with this app, you make actual and direct contributions to the OpenStreetMap.
Anything you contribute in this app is directly added to the map, there is no third party in-between the app and OSM infrastructure, like it is the case with wheelmap.org or Kort.

Editing the OpenStreetMap anonymously is not possible, so any changes you make are made with your OSM user account. This means, that the date, content and implicitly the location of your changes are visible publicly on the openstreetmap website and are attributable to your account.

Location

The app does not share your GPS location with anyone. It is used to automatically scan for quests around your area and to focus (and thus download) the map around your location.

Data Usage

As mentioned, the app directly communicates with OSM infrastructure. That is, with the Overpass API for downloading quests (which is anonymous) and with the OSM API for uploading changes.
However, before uploading your changes, the app checks with a simple text file on my server whether it has been banned from uploading any changes. This is a precautionary measure to be able to keep versions of the app that turn out to have critical bugs from possibly corrupting OSM data.

"

"

To display the map, vector tiles are retrieved from map-data.de. The service logs tile requests for anonymous statistics and for detecting issues but deletes the logs after a few days.

"
Photos you attach to a note are uploaded to my server and deleted some days after that note has been resolved. Their meta-data is stripped before upload.
For some quests, some additional data from third parties is downloaded. In particular, the oneway quest queries an API, also hosted on westnordost.de, about likely candidates for oneways.
"What surface do these steps have here?"
"What surface does this bridleway have here?"
"What surface does this path have here?"
"What surface does this piece of road have?"
"What surface does the road %s have here?"
"Select the most specific one that fits:"
"What is the name of this place?"
"What is the name of this place? (%s)"
"What is the name of this bus stop?"
"What is the name of this streetcar stop?"
"What is the speed limit for this street?"
"Are you sure no limit is posted?"
"Did you check at the ends of the street? If there are no signs along the whole street which apply for the highlighted section, default speed limits apply."
Roads in built-up areas have a lower default speed limit than rural roads.
"If there is a sign like this at the main street intersection, you won’t find individual signs within the zone because the speed limit posted there applies to the whole zone."
"What surface does the cycleway here have?"
"Is there a cycleway here? What type?"
"What kind of service road is this?"
"How many lanes does this road have?"
"If there are no road markings, it has no lanes."
"Please estimate how many cars would fit alongside each other on this road."
"What is the house number of this building?"

"Help to improve the OpenStreetMap with StreetComplete!
This app finds incomplete and extendable data in your vicinity and displays it on a map as markers. Each of those is solvable by answering a simple question to complete the info on site.
The info you enter is then directly added to the OpenStreetMap in your name, without the need to use another editor."
"Would you please send the error report to the developer?"
"Connection error while scanning for quests. Try again later."
"Connection error while uploading answers. Try again later."
"Does this bus stop have a shelter?"
"How many bikes can be parked here?"
"Note that most normal stands can be used from both sides to park each one bike."
"Is this sports field designed for exactly these sports specifically (markings and equipment are present) or as a general purpose sports field for all kinds of games?"
"Does the bus stop %s have a shelter?"
"Does this restroom have a baby changing table?"
"Does this bus stop have tactile pavings?"
"Does this streetcar stop have tactile pavings?"
"Does this crosswalk have tactile pavings on both sides?"
Are you sure you checked this on-site?
Only information that was found on a survey should be entered.
"Does the bus stop %s have tactile pavings?"
"Does the streetcar stop %s have tactile pavings?"
"Is this bicycle parking covered (protected from rain)?"

Partially means that there is no more than a single step to access the place and that most rooms inside are wheelchair accessible.
Partially means that there is no more than a single step to access it.
Partially means that there is no more than a single step to access it.
A wheelchair sign like this might be visible if the restroom is accessible. Partially means that a wheelchair can enter and use the restroom, but no handrail or adapted hand basin is present.

"If you use a default keyboard, chances are that you can simply enable the keyboard layout for the language you need in the input method settings.
Otherwise, you can download another keyboard in the app store. Popular keyboards that support many languages are Google Gboard, SwiftKey Keyboard, and Multiling O Keyboard."
What kind of fire hydrant is this?

Does %s have vegetarian meals on the menu?
Does %s have vegan meals on the menu?
Vegan meals contain no animal products (no meat, fish, poultry, milk products, eggs, …).
Vegetarian meals contain no meat, fish, or poultry.
Only answer “yes” if the place provides proper eating options for this diet, ignore starters etc.

You can leave a note to let other mappers know about an issue here. Adjust the note’s position by moving the map:
Useful if you think that some quests are outdated

Invalidating the cache causes the quests to be updated next time they are downloaded. The quest cache is invalidated automatically after one week and immediately when a quest you solved turns out to be already answered by someone else.
You need to describe what is on the sign. If there is no sign, you should ask for the opening hours inside.

Simply select the main purpose of this building. E.g. if there is a shop on the ground floor with apartments above it, it is still mainly an apartment building.
house for multiple families, may have retail outlets on the ground floor
a linear row of similar single-family homes
small detached house (summer house, holiday cottage, …)
building where people work, shop or do any other commercial activities
e.g. a factory, workshop, car repair garage, …
public building usually housing an amenity
the residential building on a farm
any building on a farm that is not a residential building
building with machinery like pumps or transformers

This quest type is disabled by default because you are usually required to check the whole street for speed limit signs, not just the highlighted section. This can sometimes be quite the stretch just to solve a single quest.
Are pedestrians prohibited from walking on this road here?
Requires application restart to apply. May bypass censorship, for example in Russia.
This street was tagged as having no sidewalk on either side. In the case that there is a sidewalk after all but it is displayed as a separate way, please answer \"sidewalk\".
Does this ferry route transport pedestrians?
Does this ferry route transport motor vehicles?
Do the trees here have needles or leaves?
Best write the note in the locally spoken language or otherwise in English.
Your answers are directly improving OpenStreetMap. Contributed data is open, everyone can use it. Many great projects are already using it.
Currently, the star count is not shared across devices, but answers are added directly to the OpenStreetMap database.
Choose one of the markers on the map and answer the question. This way you will improve OpenStreetMap data and get stars. If you see no markers you may need to zoom out the map.
What\'s the surface of the cycleway here?
What\'s the surface of the footway here?

If it differs along the way, the first step is to split up the way. After that, the quest can be answered for each split part separately.\nNote that the quests for the split parts may appear much later.\nSplit it now?
Tap on the way to split it at the point(s) where the answer differs. Try to be as precise as possible, you can zoom in as usual.
These are quite a few splits. You can always further split up the way later.
You can do this later on the settings screen.

Tap the question marks and select an answer for the given side of the road.
